metadata.title: CVE-2022-38096 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference vulnerability was found in vmwgfx driver indrivers/gpu/vmxgfx/vmxgfx_execbuf.c in GPU component of Linux kernel withdevice file '/dev/dri/renderD128 (or Dxxx)'. This flaw allows a localattacker with a user account on the system to gain privilege, causing adenial of service(DoS).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
